messages.content:
You are an expert software engineer specialized in bug localization. 
Your task is to identify the files most likely to contain bugs based on bug descriptions. 
You have access to several tools to help you in this task. 
From the files you have seen, you will select 5 files that you believe are most likely to contain the bug.

<bug_description>
Wrong URL generated by get_admin_url for readonly field in custom Admin Site
Description
	
When a model containing a ForeignKey field is viewed (or edited) in a custom Admin Site, and that ForeignKey field is listed in readonly_fields, the url generated for the link is /admin/... instead of /custom-admin/....
This appears to be caused by the following line in django.contrib.admin.helpers get_admin_url:
url = reverse(url_name, args=[quote(remote_obj.pk)])
Other parts of the admin use the current_app keyword parameter to identify the correct current name of the Admin Site. (See django.contrib.admin.options.ModelAdmin response_add as just one example)
I have been able to correct this specific issue by replacing the above line with:
url = reverse(
	url_name,
	args=[quote(remote_obj.pk)],
	current_app=self.model_admin.admin_site.name
)
However, I don't know if there are any side effects and I have not yet run the full suite of tests on this. Mostly looking for feedback whether I'm on the right track.

</bug_description>

The repository name is:
<repo_name>
django__django__475cffd1d64c690cdad16ede4d5e81985738ceb4
</repo_name>

You have access to the following tools:

* extract_relevant() -> Retrieve the most relevant info from the bug. Returns a JSON object with explanation, relevant code snippets, error messages and file paths mentioned in the bug. *

You must use these tools to find 5 files that are most likely to contain the bug. Start by analyzing the issue description and then decide which tool to use first.
If you are done, provide your final ranked list of 5 files most likely to contain bugs in a JSON array as follows: {"ranked_files": ["file1", "file2", ...]}
Otherwise, return only the tool call as JSON. Example: {"function_call": "func_name", "args": {"arg_name": 10} }
Reply ONLY with the JSON response.

extract_relevant: {'explanation': "The bug occurs when generating URLs for readonly fields in a custom Admin Site. The get_admin_url function in django.contrib.admin.helpers doesn't use the current_app parameter to identify the correct admin site, causing URLs to default to /admin/ instead of the custom admin path like /custom-admin/. This results in broken links when viewing/editing models with ForeignKey fields in readonly_fields.", 'path': 'django/contrib/admin/helpers.py', 'filename': 'helpers.py', 'identifiers': ['get_admin_url', 'reverse', 'current_app'], 'code snippet': 'url = reverse(url_name, args=[quote(remote_obj.pk)])', 'stacktrace': '', 'error_message': ''}

query_preview: The bug occurs when generating URLs for readonly fields in a custom Admin Site. The get_admin_url function in django.contrib.admin.helpers doesn't use the current_app parameter to identify the correct admin site, causing URLs to default to /admin/ instead of the custom admin path like /custom-admin/. This results in broken links when viewing/editing models with ForeignKey fields in readonly_fields. django/contrib/admin/helpers.py helpers.py get_admin_url reverse current_app url = reverse(url_name, args=[quote(remote_obj.pk)])

I have been able to correct this specific issue by replacing the above line with:
url = reverse(
	url_name,
	args=[quote(remote_obj.pk)],
	current_app=self.model_admin.admin_site.name
)
However, I don't know if there are any side effects and I have not yet run the full suite of tests on this. Mostly looking for feedback whether I'm on the right track.

</bug_description>

You are an expert software engineer specialized in bug localization. 
Your task is to identify the files most likely to contain bugs based on bug descriptions. 
You have access to several tools to help you in this task. 
From the files you have seen, you will select 5 files that you believe are most likely to contain the bug.

<bug_description>
Wrong URL generated by get_admin_url for readonly field in custom Admin Site
Description
	
When a model containing a ForeignKey field is viewed (or edited) in a custom Admin Site, and that ForeignKey field is listed in readonly_fields, the url generated for the link is /admin/... instead of /custom-admin/....
This appears to be caused by the following line in django.contrib.admin.helpers get_admin_url:
url = reverse(url_name, args=[quote(remote_obj.pk)])
Other parts of the admin use the current_app keyword parameter to identify the correct current name of the Admin Site. (See django.contrib.admin.options.ModelAdmin response_add as just one example)
I have been able to correct this specific issue by replacing the above line with:
url = reverse(
	url_name,
	args=[quote(remote_obj.pk)],
	current_app=self.model_admin.admin_site.name
)
However, I don't know if there are any side effects and I have not yet run the full suite of tests on this. Mostly looking for feedback whether I'm on the right track.

</bug_description>

The repository name is:
<repo_name>
django__django__475cffd1d64c690cdad16ede4d5e81985738ceb4
</repo_name>

You are an expert software engineer specialized in bug localization. 
Your task is to identify the files most likely to contain bugs based on bug descriptions.

From the files you have seen, you will select 5 files that you believe are most likely to contain the bug.

<bug_description>
Wrong URL generated by get_admin_url for readonly field in custom Admin Site
Description
	
When a model containing a ForeignKey field is viewed (or edited) in a custom Admin Site, and that ForeignKey field is listed in readonly_fields, the url generated for the link is /admin/... instead of /custom-admin/....
This appears to be caused by the following line in django.contrib.admin.helpers get_admin_url:
url = reverse(url_name, args=[quote(remote_obj.pk)])
Other parts of the admin use the current_app keyword parameter to identify the correct current name of the Admin Site. (See django.contrib.admin.options.ModelAdmin response_add as just one example)
I have been able to correct this specific issue by replacing the above line with:
url = reverse(
	url_name,
	args=[quote(remote_obj.pk)],
	current_app=self.model_admin.admin_site.name
)
However, I don't know if there are any side effects and I have not yet run the full suite of tests on this. Mostly looking for feedback whether I'm on the right track.

</bug_description>

You are an expert software engineer specialized in bug localization. 
Your task is to review a ranked list of files most likely to contain bugs based on a bug description.

This is the bug description:
<bug_description>
Wrong URL generated by get_admin_url for readonly field in custom Admin Site
Description
	
When a model containing a ForeignKey field is viewed (or edited) in a custom Admin Site, and that ForeignKey field is listed in readonly_fields, the url generated for the link is /admin/... instead of /custom-admin/....
This appears to be caused by the following line in django.contrib.admin.helpers get_admin_url:
url = reverse(url_name, args=[quote(remote_obj.pk)])
Other parts of the admin use the current_app keyword parameter to identify the correct current name of the Admin Site. (See django.contrib.admin.options.ModelAdmin response_add as just one example)
I have been able to correct this specific issue by replacing the above line with:
url = reverse(
	url_name,
	args=[quote(remote_obj.pk)],
	current_app=self.model_admin.admin_site.name
)
However, I don't know if there are any side effects and I have not yet run the full suite of tests on this. Mostly looking for feedback whether I'm on the right track.

</bug_description>
